signature: apoc.algo.aStar(startNode :: NODE, endNode :: NODE, relTypesAndDirections :: STRING, weightPropertyName :: STRING, latPropertyName :: STRING, lonPropertyName :: STRING) :: (path :: PATH, weight :: FLOAT)
name: apoc.algo.aStar
description: Runs the A* search algorithm to find the optimal path between two `NODE` values, using the given `RELATIONSHIP` property name for the cost function.

returnDescription.name: path
returnDescription.description: The path result.

returnDescription.name: weight
returnDescription.description: The weight of the given path.

argumentDescription.name: startNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to start the search from.

argumentDescription.name: endNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to end the search on.

argumentDescription.name: relTypesAndDirections
argumentDescription.description: The relationship types to restrict the algorithm to. Relationship types are represented using APOC's rel-direction-pattern syntax; `[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE1[>]|[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE2[>]|...`.

argumentDescription.name: weightPropertyName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the property to use as the weight.

argumentDescription.name: latPropertyName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the property to use as the latitude.

argumentDescription.name: lonPropertyName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the property to use as the longitude.

signature: apoc.algo.aStarConfig(startNode :: NODE, endNode :: NODE, relTypesAndDirections :: STRING, config :: MAP) :: (path :: PATH, weight :: FLOAT)
name: apoc.algo.aStarConfig
description:
Runs the A* search algorithm to find the optimal path between two `NODE` values, using the given `RELATIONSHIP` property name for the cost function.
This procedure looks for weight, latitude and longitude properties in the config.

returnDescription.name: path
returnDescription.description: The path result.

returnDescription.name: weight
returnDescription.description: The weight of the given path.

argumentDescription.name: startNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to start the search from.

argumentDescription.name: endNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to end the search on.

argumentDescription.name: relTypesAndDirections
argumentDescription.description: The relationship types to restrict the algorithm to. Relationship types are represented using APOC's rel-direction-pattern syntax; `[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE1[>]|[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE2[>]|...`.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: { weight = 'distance' :: STRING, default = Double.MAX_VALUE :: FLOAT, y = 'latitude' :: STRING, x = 'longitude' :: STRING, pointPropName :: STRING }

signature: apoc.algo.allSimplePaths(startNode :: NODE, endNode :: NODE, relTypesAndDirections :: STRING, maxNodes :: INTEGER) :: (path :: PATH)
name: apoc.algo.allSimplePaths
description:
Runs a search algorithm to find all of the simple paths between the given `RELATIONSHIP` values, up to a max depth described by `maxNodes`.
The returned paths will not contain loops.

returnDescription.name: path
returnDescription.description: The path result.

argumentDescription.name: startNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to start the search from.

argumentDescription.name: endNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to end the search on.

argumentDescription.name: relTypesAndDirections
argumentDescription.description: The relationship types to restrict the algorithm to. Relationship types are represented using APOC's rel-direction-pattern syntax; `[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE1[>]|[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE2[>]|...`.

argumentDescription.name: maxNodes
argumentDescription.description: The max depth (in terms of nodes) the algorithm will explore.

signature: apoc.algo.cover(nodes :: ANY) :: (rel :: RELATIONSHIP)
name: apoc.algo.cover
description: Returns all `RELATIONSHIP` values connecting the given set of `NODE` values.

returnDescription.name: rel
returnDescription.description: The relationships connected to the given nodes.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to look for connected relationships on.

signature: apoc.algo.dijkstra(startNode :: NODE, endNode :: NODE, relTypesAndDirections :: STRING, weightPropertyName :: STRING, defaultWeight = NaN :: FLOAT, numberOfWantedPaths = 1 :: INTEGER) :: (path :: PATH, weight :: FLOAT)
name: apoc.algo.dijkstra
description: Runs Dijkstra's algorithm using the given `RELATIONSHIP` property as the cost function.

returnDescription.name: path
returnDescription.description: The path result.

returnDescription.name: weight
returnDescription.description: The weight of the given path.

argumentDescription.name: startNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to start the search from.

argumentDescription.name: endNode
argumentDescription.description: The node to end the search on.

argumentDescription.name: relTypesAndDirections
argumentDescription.description: The relationship types to restrict the algorithm to. Relationship types are represented using APOC's rel-direction-pattern syntax; `[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE1[>]|[<]RELATIONSHIP_TYPE2[>]|...`.

argumentDescription.name: weightPropertyName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the property to use as the weight.

argumentDescription.name: defaultWeight
argumentDescription.description: The `defaultWeight` is used when no specific weight is provided for the given relationship or node. The default value for defaultWeight is NaN.

argumentDescription.name: numberOfWantedPaths
argumentDescription.description: The number of wanted paths to return.

signature: apoc.atomic.add(container :: ANY, propertyName :: STRING, number :: INTEGER | FLOAT, retryAttempts = 5 :: INTEGER) :: (container :: ANY, property :: STRING, oldValue :: ANY, newValue :: ANY)

argumentDescription.description: The number to add.

argumentDescription.name: retryAttempts
argumentDescription.description: The max retry attempts.

signature: apoc.case(conditionals :: LIST<ANY>, elseQuery =  :: STRING, params = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.case
description: For each pair of conditional and read-only queries in the given `LIST<ANY>`, this procedure will run the first query for which the conditional is evaluated to true. If none of the conditionals are true, the `ELSE` query will run instead.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the evaluated Cypher query.

argumentDescription.name: conditionals
argumentDescription.description: A list of conditionals, where each conditional is a pair: the first element is a predicate, and the second is a Cypher query to be executed based on that predicate.

argumentDescription.name: elseQuery
argumentDescription.description: A Cypher query to evaluate if all conditionals evaluate to false.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: A map of parameters to be used in the executed Cypher query.

signature: apoc.do.case(conditionals :: LIST<ANY>, elseQuery =  :: STRING, params = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.do.case
description:
For each pair of conditional queries in the given `LIST<ANY>`, this procedure will run the first query for which the conditional is evaluated to true.
If none of the conditionals are true, the `ELSE` query will run instead.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the evaluated Cypher query.

argumentDescription.name: conditionals
argumentDescription.description: A list of conditionals, where each conditional is a pair: the first element is a predicate, and the second is a Cypher query to be executed based on that predicate.

argumentDescription.name: elseQuery
argumentDescription.description: A Cypher query to evaluate if all conditionals evaluate to false.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: A map of parameters to be used in the executed Cypher query.

signature: apoc.do.when(condition :: BOOLEAN, ifQuery :: STRING, elseQuery :: STRING, params = {} :: MAP) :: (value :: MAP)
name: apoc.do.when
description: Runs the given read/write `ifQuery` if the conditional has evaluated to true, otherwise the `elseQuery` will run.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The result returned from the evaluated Cypher query.

argumentDescription.name: condition
argumentDescription.description: The predicate that determines whether to execute the `ifQuery`.

argumentDescription.name: ifQuery
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher statement to run if the condition is true.

argumentDescription.name: elseQuery
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher statement to run if the condition is false.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: The parameters for the given Cypher statement.

returnDescription.description: The count of seen values.

returnDescription.description: If all seen values are unique.

returnDescription.name: existence
returnDescription.description: If an existence constraint exists for this property.

returnDescription.name: type
returnDescription.description: The type represented by this row.

returnDescription.name: array
returnDescription.description: Indicates whether the property is an array. If the type column is "RELATIONSHIP," this will be true if there is at least one node with two outgoing relationships of the type specified by the label or property column.

returnDescription.name: sample
returnDescription.description: This is always null.

returnDescription.description: The ratio (rounded down) of the count of outgoing relationships for a specific label and relationship type relative to the total count of those patterns.

returnDescription.name: right
returnDescription.description: The ratio (rounded down) of the count of incoming relationships for a specific label and relationship type relative to the total count of those patterns.

returnDescription.name: other
returnDescription.description: The labels of connect nodes.

returnDescription.name: otherLabels
returnDescription.description: For uniqueness constraints, this field shows other labels present on nodes that also contain the uniqueness constraint.

returnDescription.name: elementType
returnDescription.description: Whether this refers to a node or a relationship.

argumentDescription.description: Number of nodes to sample, setting sample to `-1` will remove sampling; { sample = 1000 :: INTEGER }

}

name: apoc.refactor.cloneSubgraph
description:
Clones the given `NODE` values with their labels and properties (optionally skipping any properties in the `skipProperties` `LIST<STRING>` via the config `MAP`), and clones the given `RELATIONSHIP` values.
If no `RELATIONSHIP` values are provided, all existing `RELATIONSHIP` values between the given `NODE` values will be cloned.

returnDescription.name: input
returnDescription.description: The internal id of the original entity.

returnDescription.name: output
returnDescription.description: The copied entity.

returnDescription.name: error
returnDescription.description: Any error that occurred during the copy process.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to be cloned.

argumentDescription.name: rels
argumentDescription.description: The relationships to be cloned. If left empty all relationships between the given nodes will be cloned.

argumentDescription.name: config

signature: apoc.refactor.cloneSubgraphFromPaths(paths :: LIST<PATH>, config = {} :: MAP) :: (input :: INTEGER, output :: NODE, error :: STRING)
name: apoc.refactor.cloneSubgraphFromPaths
description:
Clones a sub-graph defined by the given `LIST<PATH>` values.
It is possible to skip any `NODE` properties using the `skipProperties` `LIST<STRING>` via the config `MAP`.

returnDescription.name: input
returnDescription.description: The internal id of the original entity.

returnDescription.name: output
returnDescription.description: The copied entity.

returnDescription.name: error
returnDescription.description: Any error that occurred during the copy process.

argumentDescription.name: paths
argumentDescription.description: The paths to be cloned.

argumentDescription.name: config

signature: apoc.refactor.collapseNode(nodes :: ANY, relType :: STRING) :: (input :: INTEGER, output :: RELATIONSHIP, error :: STRING)
name: apoc.refactor.collapseNode
description: Collapses the given `NODE` and replaces it with a `RELATIONSHIP` of the given type.

returnDescription.name: input
returnDescription.description: The id of the given relationship.

returnDescription.name: output
returnDescription.description: The id of the new relationship with the updated type.

returnDescription.name: error
returnDescription.description: The message if an error occurred.

argumentDescription.name: nodes
argumentDescription.description: The nodes to collapse. Nodes can be of type `STRING` (elementId()), `INTEGER` (id()), `NODE`, or `LIST<STRING | INTEGER | NODE>`.

argumentDescription.name: relType
argumentDescription.description: The name of the resulting relationship type.

signature: apoc.refactor.extractNode(rels :: ANY, labels :: LIST<STRING>, outType :: STRING, inType :: STRING) :: (input :: INTEGER, output :: NODE, error :: STRING)
name: apoc.refactor.extractNode
description:
Expands the given `RELATIONSHIP` VALUES into intermediate `NODE` VALUES.
The intermediate `NODE` values are connected by the given `outType` and `inType`.

returnDescription.name: input
returnDescription.description: The internal id of the original entity.

returnDescription.name: output
returnDescription.description: The copied entity.

returnDescription.name: error
returnDescription.description: Any error that occurred during the copy process.

argumentDescription.name: rels
argumentDescription.description: The relationships to turn into new nodes. Relationships can be of type `STRING` (elementId()), `INTEGER` (id()), `RELATIONSHIP`, or `LIST<STRING | INTEGER | RELATIONSHIP>`.

argumentDescription.name: labels
argumentDescription.description: The labels to be added to the new nodes.

argumentDescription.name: outType
argumentDescription.description: The type of the outgoing relationship.

argumentDescription.name: inType
argumentDescription.description: The type of the ingoing relationship.

All `RELATIONSHIP` values are merged onto that `NODE` as well.

    selfRef :: BOOLEAN,
    produceSelfRef = true :: BOOLEAN,
    preserveExistingSelfRels = true :: BOOLEAN,
    countMerge = true :: BOOLEAN,
    collapsedLabel :: BOOLEAN,
    singleElementAsArray = false :: BOOLEAN,
    avoidDuplicates = false :: BOOLEAN,
    relationshipSelectionStrategy = "incoming" :: ["incoming", "outgoing", "merge"]
    properties :: ["overwrite", ""discard", "combine"]
}
